decks.notes: This deck focuses on using the Birthing Ritual card in combination with various creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck includes a mix of control elements, card advantage, and strong creatures to maintain board presence and apply pressure. The key strategy is to ramp up mana quickly with Birthing Ritual and efficiently use the resources to outpace and outvalue the opponent, utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Ice-Fang Coatl to generate card advantage while applying pressure with creatures like Harbinger of the Seas and Abhorrent Oculus.

This deck focuses on generating as much mana as possible to cast spells quickly and efficiently. It includes cards that reduce the cost of casting spells, such as Ruby Medallion, along with spells like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual to generate extra mana. The goal is to combo off and cast multiple spells in a turn to build up to a lethal Grapeshot. The deck also includes cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wish to help filter through the deck and find key pieces to go off. The main concept is to quickly generate mana and combo off for a win.

This deck focuses on assembling the Amulet Titan combo, which involves using Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and playing Primeval Titan to tutor for powerful lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva. The deck also utilizes card draw, land ramp, and control elements to help set up the combo and protect it once it is assembled. The goal is to quickly ramp up mana and overpower the opponent with powerful land-based abilities and combos.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by ramping up quickly with the UrzaTron lands and using powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Karn, the Great Creator can shut down artifact-based decks, while Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provides board control. Devourer of Destiny and Sowing Mycospawn offer additional threats and disruption, making it difficult for the opponent to establish a strong board presence. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent in order to secure a win.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to flood the board with aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer while controlling the opponent's board with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge. The deck also utilizes powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Seasoned Pyromancer to maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, cards like Arena of Glory and Elegant Parlor provide additional support for the aggressive strategy. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and removal spells.

This deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with low-cost artifacts and utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga to generate value and threats. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures, disruptive spells, and synergistic artifacts, while also having access to tools like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The focus is on quickly building a board presence and leveraging efficient cards to push for a fast win.

This Ruby Storm deck is focused on generating a large amount of mana quickly using rituals and medallions to cast spells like Past in Flames and Ral, Monsoon Mage. The deck aims to chain spells together to deal a significant amount of damage with cards like Grapeshot and Strike It Rich. It also includes ways to draw cards and find key pieces with cards like Reckless Impulse and Valakut Awakening. The deck utilizes the combo potential of the cards to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a burst of powerful spells.

The deck focuses on establishing board control and disrupting opponents with Eldrazi creatures and powerful artifacts. The key strategy revolves around assembling UrzaTron (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate massive amounts of mana to cast game-ending threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Karn, the Great Creator. Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny provide disruption while Ugin's Labyrinth and Kozilek's Command offer additional removal and control options. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big creatures and powerful spells while controlling the game.

This combo deck aims to use Ruby Medallion to reduce the cost of spells, generating mana with rituals and cantrips like Manamorphose to play multiple spells in a turn. Wrenn's Resolve is used to protect key cards, while Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot provide direct damage to finish off opponents. Past in Flames allows for graveyard recursion, and Wish enables access to sideboard cards. The deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with powerful spells and synergies.

The deck focuses on using the UrzaTron lands to ramp up resources quickly, enabling fast plays with powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers. It utilizes control elements like Thought-Knot Seer and Kozilek's Command to disrupt opponents while creating opportunities to push through with massive threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption, while cards like Devourer of Destiny and Ugin's Labyrinth help maintain board control. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of efficient removal, resource acceleration, and high-impact threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Allosaurus Rider along with various cards like Eldritch Evolution, Neoform, and Summoner's Pact to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand. The deck aims to assemble a combo that can generate a significant advantage on the board, while also using cards like Consign to Memory and Veil of Summer to protect its key pieces. The inclusion of cards like Planar Genesis and Ureni, the Song Unending helps to provide additional support and consistency to the combo strategy.

The deck focuses on control through ramping up mana with Eldrazi Temple, Utopia Sprawl, and Talisman of Impulse to deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also disrupts opponents with cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Kozilek's Command while generating value with cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Malevolent Rumble. It has a toolbox approach with cards like Ghost Quarter and Bojuka Bog to deal with specific threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats while controlling the game.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts such as Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to create a powerful board state with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, while also having access to artifact removal and graveyard hate. The inclusion of Engineered Explosives and Shadowspear allows for flexible answers to various threats, making it a versatile and resilient Aggro - Affinity archetype.

This deck focuses on manipulating the graveyard to cascade into powerful creatures for a combo finish. By cycling cards like Street Wraith and Generous Ent, the goal is to fill the graveyard and then cast Living End to bring back a board of powerful creatures while disrupting the opponent with cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety. The creatures in the deck, like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves, provide additional value and pressure to close out the game quickly after resolving Living End. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its graveyard shenanigans and efficient threats.

The main concept of this 1 vs 1 Modern Aggro - Hollow One deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with discarded cards, allowing for powerful creatures like Hollow One and Detective's Phoenix to be played for free or at a reduced cost. Burning Inquiry and Faithless Looting help achieve this goal, while cards like Street Wraith and Nethergoyf benefit from having a full graveyard. Lightning Bolt and Orcish Bowmasters provide additional removal and Tarfire and Unholy Heat can deal with smaller threats. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and aggressive plays.

The deck revolves around quickly ramping up mana with land cards like Gruul Turf and Arboreal Grazer, while utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate additional mana. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces needed to play Primeval Titan and search for powerful lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Lotus Field. Once these pieces are in place, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with large creatures and game-ending spells like Scapeshift. Additionally, cards like Aftermath Analyst and Malevolent Rumble provide additional utility and disruption to control the game tempo.
